It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
